description:
doc: mention 'hg update default' in contribution guidelines

Fixes issue 3634.

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

http://codereview.appspot.com/6270047/diff/3001/doc/contribute.html
File doc/contribute.html (right):

http://codereview.appspot.com/6270047/diff/3001/doc/contribute.html#newcode169
doc/contribute.html:169: Most Go installations are synced to a release branch, but new changes should
is "synced" a word? Maybe write synchronized instead.

http://codereview.appspot.com/6270047/diff/3001/doc/contribute.html#newcode172
doc/contribute.html:172: Before making a change, make sure you are synced to the default branch:
ditto

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=222a28e46943 ***

      doc: mention 'hg update default' in contribution guidelines

Fixes issue 3634.

R=golang-dev, bsiegert, rsc
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/6270047

http://codereview.appspot.com/6270047/diff/3001/doc/contribute.html
File doc/contribute.html (right):

http://codereview.appspot.com/6270047/diff/3001/doc/contribute.html#newcode169
doc/contribute.html:169: Most Go installations are synced to a release branch, but new changes should
On 2012/06/04 09:01:07, bsiegert wrote:
> is "synced" a word? Maybe write synchronized instead.

It's a perfectly cromulent word.

first: s/are synced to/use/
second: s/are synced to/are using/

subject: code review 6270047:       doc: mention 'hg update default' in contribution ...
